intro: Eupatorium shaferi, commonly known as Shafer's boneset, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded areas with rich, organic soil. Its leaves are usually opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Eupatorium shaferi is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other familiar flowering plants.
